One might argue that yes is in the process of turning into a verbal element, and in that case
the presence of et is not surprising. There are, however, many differences between yes and real verbs,
and at least one should admit that et is not restricted to lexical items that show the full inflectional
paradigm of verbs. See Doron (1983) and Shlonsky (1987) for a discussion of the properties of yes.
